subject: Climate & Environment
title: Wind Energy and Wildlife
description: A 60-second lesson on Wind Energy and Wildlife.

hook.text: Wind turbines kill an estimated 500,000 birds per year in the US. That sounds bad.

buildup.text: For context, house cats kill about 2.4 billion birds per year in the same country.

discovery.text: Painting one blade black has cut bird deaths by 70% at some sites in Norway.

twist.text: Bats are actually more vulnerable. Air pressure drops near blades damage their lungs.

climax.text: Smart sensors now detect approaching flocks and briefly pause turbines to let them pass.

punchline.text: Wind power can coexist with wildlife. It just takes smarter design.

quiz.question: What simple change reduced bird deaths at Norwegian turbines by 70%?
